entry.title: Introducing Threads
entry.content:
We are really proud to announce that Suttna now supports threads üòå

When we started building Suttna, our main goal was to let users configure everything without leaving their messaging client.

Having that in mind, our first idea was to create a subset of dialogs where users would be able to just start a conversation running a command (e.g. @suttna configure) and Suttna will guide them according to what they wanted to do.



One of the aspects that we didn‚Äôt thought at first was, how much distraction Suttna can create on a particular channel? How can we avoid distracting team members?

Why should I get 20 message notifications if I‚Äôm not even configuring a checkin, right? ü§Ø

Now that Suttna has a few months running checkins for companies around the globe, we understood that bot conversations are nice, buuut that they can be a bit annoying (just a bit üòÖ).

So we started collecting feedback from several accounts and decided that it was time to fix it.

Most users asked for a new config option to prevent Suttna messaging the channel right after a user finishes answering their questions, so all the summaries would be posted to the channel only once when the checkin finishes, but that was a solution for only one scenario, what about commands like @suttna configure for example? that would still trigger a notification for each new message.



After thinking about other solutions, we decided to use threads (both messaging clients Slack and MS Teams support them). Suttna will create a new thread when entering a command and continue the conversation right there. This new flow won‚Äôt generate message notifications and won‚Äôt send too many messages to the group channel, much better of course.

But it wasn‚Äôt all a bed of roses, the Slack connector (botbuilder-slack) that we‚Äôve built for Microsoft Botbuilder didn‚Äôt support threads, obviously that didn‚Äôt last too much, one week after our connector supports them üòç. Check out here all of our contributions http://github.com/suttna.

We love to improve constantly, and your opinion really matter to us! (threads wasn‚Äôt an exception).

Any feedback will be more than welcome so please, write to the team at feedback@suttna.com if you have anything to say.

entry.title: New Web Application
entry.content:
A few weeks ago we rolled out a new web application that will let you search your checkin‚Äôs history.

Multiple customers have requested this feature, we invite everyone to try it. In order to login for first time in you need to ask for a login link to Suttna. @suttna login will do the work. Suttna will send you a special link for you that can be used to access the web application for the first time.

The new application will show you all the checkin events that are associated with the checkins you are participant of.

You can filter the events by the checkin they belong to and the time that the event happened. It‚Äôs also possible to filter the events and get information from a specific person. This can be useful when trying to figure out what you or other team member have done in a give time period.

This is just the begging of our web application. We want to get feedback from our users and improve based on that. Any feedback will be more than welcome so please, write to the team at feedback@suttna.com if you have anything to say.
